intro: Brachyscome clementii, commonly known as the pink chalice, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It is a small annual herb that typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant produces fluffy, pink or purple flowers that resemble tiny chalices, blooming from spring to autumn. It is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and used in floral arrangements.
